description: Dimmer flush mount compatible to Busch-Jaeger
exclusion: Press and hold the upper position of the left button (T1) for at least 10 seconds when the shutter is in the top position.
inclusion: Press the upper position of the left button (T1) 3x within a second.
overview:
The TechniSat dimmer controls the brightness of a ceiling lamp, for instance, via the rockers. At the same time, the system can also be integrated into a Z-Wave Smart Home system in order to set dazzling lighting accents or to create a special mood with lighting.

What's more, you can determine how much electricity you use and the dimmer can be integrated into complex schemes in smart home systems.

The dimmer can be installed in standard flush-mounted boxes (DIN 49073-1)

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Central scene notification
parameters.description: Enable/Disable Central scene notifcations for 2x-5x press

parameters.label: Wattage meter
parameters.description: Interval Current wattage meter report in 10s
parameters.overview: Interval of current wattage meter report in 10 second steps, 30s ... 1day, 0 - disable

parameters.label: Energy meter report
parameters.description: Interval of active energy meter report in minutes
parameters.overview: Interval of active energy meter report in minutes, 10min ... 3 weeks, 0 - disable

parameters.label: Operation mode of T1 and T2
parameters.description: Function of switch position T1 (up) and T2 (down)
parameters.overview:
0 - T1 turns output L1 on, T2 turn output L1 off

1 - T1 and T2 toggle output L1

options.label: T1 turns output L1 on, T2 turn output L1 off
T1 and T2 toggle output L1

parameters.label: Extension connector switch type
parameters.description: Configuration of switch type connected to extension connector S
parameters.overview:
0 - a toggle switch type is connected to extension connector S

1 - a push button switch type is connected to extension connector S

options.label: a toggle switch type is connected to extension connector S
a push button switch type is connected to extension connector S

parameters.label: Extension connector central scenes
parameters.description: Central Scene mapping of extension input S
parameters.overview:
1 - map extension input S to central scene of T1

2: map extension input S to central scene of T2

3: map extension input S to own central scene

options.label: map extension input S to central scene of T1
map extension input S to central scene of T2
map extension input S to own central scene

parameters.label: Dimming curve selection
parameters.overview:
0 - select dimming curve 1

1 - select dimming curve 2

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: The lifeline group reports the device's status.

- Device Reset Locally Notification

associations.label: Basic SET
associations.description: Sends basic set commands to associated devices, according to the current state of the device.
associations.overview: Z-Wave devices control other Z-Wave devices. The relationship between one device controlling another device is called association. In order to control a different device, the controlling device needs to maintain a list of devices that will receive controlling commands. These lists are called association groups and they are always related to certain events (e.g. button pressed, sensor triggers, ...). In case the event happens all devices stored in the respective association group will receive the same wireless command wireless command, typically a 'Basic Set' Command.
